units.title: Tissue cleaning and crypt isolation
units.text: colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen-Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The epithelium was then minced from tissue segments using scalpels (Fisher Scientific) and collected into 50 mL conical tubes. Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen-Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 4 °C, 500 × g for 3 min between each wash.
units.rationale: This is a step-by-step procedure for cleaning colon tissue and isolating crypts for organoid generation.

units.title: EDTA digestion for crypt release
units.text: The tissue was then resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min. Following digestion, the EDTA digestion solution was topped up with 20 mL of DMEM++, filtered through sterile gauze, and centrifuged for 3 min at 4 °C, 500 × g.
units.rationale: This describes a specific, actionable protocol step for digesting tissue to release crypts using EDTA.

units.title: Crypt plating in Matrigel
units.text: The pellet was then resuspended in 10 mL PBS+++, filtered through a 100 µm cell strainer, and centrifuged for 3 min at 4 °C, 500. The tissue was then ready for plating in Matrigel (Corning) by resuspending in cold Matrigel and plating into 30 μL Matrigel droplets, at a density of 30–50 crypts per droplet. Once Matrigel had solidified for 30 min at 37 °C, crypts were fed with organoid growth media.
units.rationale: This is a precise protocol for embedding crypts in Matrigel droplets and initiating organoid culture.

units.title: Organoid growth media composition
units.text: Organoid growth media: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen-Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B-27 Supplement (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein (ImmunoPrecise Antibodies), 5 nM Gastrin-1 (Tocris), 1.25mM N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine (Sigma-Aldrich), 10 mM Nicotinamide (Sigma-Aldrich), 100 µg/mL Primocin (InvivoGen), 500 nM A 83-01 (Tocris), 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF (R&D Systems), 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin (R&D Systems), 250 ng/mL recombinant human R-spondin 3 (Roche), 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1 (BioLegend), 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2 (PeproTech).
units.rationale: This is a verbatim list of components and concentrations for organoid growth media, a critical protocol detail.

units.title: Organoid passaging protocol
units.text: To passage, organoids were mechanically dislodged from Cultrex domes using a P1000 pipette tip and resuspended in cold 10 mM EDTA with 10 µM Y-27632 (STEMCELL Technologies) in a 15 mL conical tube. The tube containing organoids was then placed on an end-over-end rotator at 4 °C for 30 min and then centrifuged for 5 min at 500 ×g, 4 °C. Organoids were then resuspended in 1X Trypsin (Fisher Scientific) and placed in an end-over-end rotator for 6 min at 37 °C. Following dissociation, Trypsin was neutralized with DMEM containing 10% FBS, and organoids were centrifuged for 5 min at 500 × g, 4 °C.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, stepwise protocol for passaging organoids using EDTA and trypsin.

units.title: Organoid culture in microwell plates
units.text: Experiments involving microwell plates utilized 500 µm Gri3D plates (SUN bioscience). Prior to organoid seeding, storage buffer was aspirated from each well and 150 µL of Advanced DMEM/F12 was added through the pipetting port. The plate was placed in the tissue culture incubator for at least 30 min. Organoids that had been maintained in Cultrex domes for at least 5 days after passaging were removed from the ECM following the passaging protocol as above, but dissociated for 12 min in Trypsin rather than 6, or until organoids were largely single cells. Trypsin was neutralized and organoids were washed as in the passaging protocol. Following the PBS wash, organoids were resuspended in organoid growth media without Nicotinamide: Advanced DMEM/F12 supplemented with 1X Pen-Strep, 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X B-27 Supplement, 0.2 nM Wnt Surrogate protein, 5 nM Gastrin-1, 1.25mM N-Acetyl-L-Cysteine, 100 µg/mL Primocin, 500 nM A 83-01, 50 ng/mL recombinant human EGF, 100 ng/mL recombinant human Noggin, 250 ng/mL recombinant human R-spondin 3, 100 ng/mL recombinant human IGF1, 50 ng/mL recombinant human FGF2, and with 10 µM Y-27632. Dissociated organoids were then counted using a hemocytometer and seeded into the microwell plates at a density of 200 cells per microwell, in 50 µL of media per well. The plates were placed in the incubator for 30–60 min to allow the cells to settle, after which another 100 µL of media containing 2% Matrigel was added per well. It is critical that Matrigel is added to the media while cold.
units.rationale: This is a comprehensive, actionable protocol for seeding organoids into microwell plates with precise conditions and timing.

units.title: DSS injury treatment in organoids
units.text: For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media. The low and high doses considered were 0.1% DSS and 0.5% (wt/vol) DSS in media.
units.rationale: This describes a specific, reproducible protocol for inducing injury with DSS in organoids, including concentration and duration.

units.title: Cytomix injury treatment in organoids
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFɑ (R&D Systems), IFNɣ (R&D systems), and IL-1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide) for 8 hours, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media. The low and high doses considered were 10 ng/mL TNFɑ, 10 ng/mL IFNɣ, 1 ng/mL IL1β and 50 ng/mL TNFɑ, 50 ng/mL IFNɣ, 5 ng/mL IL1β.
units.rationale: This is a precise protocol for applying cytomix to induce inflammation in organoids with defined cytokine concentrations and exposure time.

units.title: Irradiation injury protocol
units.text: For irradiation studies, the plates were placed on the center of the rotating table of the irradiator (J.L. Shepherd and Associates, Mark I series, model 68A, Cesium (137Cs) gamma irradiator) for the time periods equivalent to either 6 Gy or 12 Gy, and then the organoids were further cultured in the incubator.
units.rationale: This provides a specific, actionable protocol for applying controlled radiation doses to organoids.

units.title: FITC-dextran permeability assay
units.text: Organoid permeability and apoptosis measurements were conducted on one day post-injury, and FITC-dextran was used to assess barrier integrity. Briefly, organoids were incubated in a solution of 4kDA FITC-Dextran (MedChemExpress) diluted to 2 mg/mL in PBS for 5 min in µ-slides (Ibidi) to allow organoids to settle to the bottom of the slide. Organoids were then imaged on a Nikon spinning disc confocal to collect fluorescence and DIC images, and the percentage of intact organoids was calculated as the number of organoids per condition/donor that excluded FITC-dextran from the lumen divided by the total number of organoids.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, stepwise protocol for measuring epithelial barrier integrity using FITC-dextran exclusion.
